Housing Market | Real Estate 3 minute read
Where manufactured homes are filling the housing affordability gap
In 2024, the average new manufactured home cost about $123,300
November 19, 2025, 11:49am by Jonathan Delozier
News
>
Real Estate
Article Summary

Manufactured housing is expanding nationwide, led by Sunbelt states. Florida has the largest inventory, while New Mexico leads by share. Cities like Mesa and Largo show strong concentrations. With average costs near $123,000, manufactured homes offer rare affordability. Despite zoning hurdles, modern designs and rising demand are accelerating adoption across diverse markets.  AI Summary

Manufactured housing continues to widen its reach, led by the Sunbelt, where warm climates, flexible zoning and lower land costs make factory-built homes a durable affordability option.

Nationally, about 7.9 million manufactured units account for 5.4% of all housing, according to a new study from Storage Cafe.

About Jonathan Delozier
Jonathan Delozier is a veteran journalist with more than a decade of newsroom experience. In addition to housing and real estate coverage, he has provided detailed analysis of local government, public schools, the COVID-19 pandemic, numerous criminal trials, and the national opioid epidemic.
